subtitle: [Music]
In this desired outcome meditation, you can
imagine creating a desired outcome you would
most like to achieve. What is it you most desire?
What is for your highest good and greatest joy?
Is there some goal or intention you would like
to achieve? Perhaps some type of ideal outcome?
Perhaps it's related to your own sense of
self, or maybe related to work, career, play,
health, or relationship, or maybe some type of experience you most wish to have.
Sometimes thinking about what you don't want
to have or experience can help you get more
clear on what your goal or intention is you would
most like to experience. What would this bring
into your life? What experience might you have?
How would it serve you in your path forward? How
would it serve you in your path now? What feeling
would it give you? Perhaps a sense of joy, love,
peace, a feeling of purpose, confidence, compassion
or harmony, or maybe even less stress, pain,
grief or fear. Go ahead and get comfortable
either seated or lying down in an area that's
relatively free of distractions. Bring your
awareness to your body. Bring your awareness
to your mind. Bring your awareness to your breath
and notice how you're breathing. Consciously let
any tension or stress you might be holding in your
body to just melt into the earth below you. Go
ahead and take a slow, gentle, deep breath in,
expanding your abdomen as much as is comfortable,
and then slowly exhaling, letting your abdomen
come back toward your body. With each exhale,
let any tension or stress you may be holding in
your mind or body to just simply let go. Breathing
in, allow the abdomen to expand out. Breathing
out, letting the abdomen come back toward your
body, releasing any tension or stress or any
holding in the joints or muscles. Not forcing
anything to happen, just allowing it to happen
at its own pace. Continue breathing in an
unforced, effortless way that is most comfortable
for you. If you would like, invite in a feeling
of warmth, coolness or comfort into your body,
relaxing any tension you may be experiencing,
perhaps visualizing sunlight, gently moving
through your body, bringing you comfort and peace,
allowing the sunlight to move into the top
of your head, slowly down into your neck and
shoulders, bringing a sense of warmth and peace
and comfort as it moves down into your arms and
into your hands, perhaps even a sense of being
revitalized or rejuvenated, releasing any tension
or stress or energy from any environments you've
been in or any people or places you've been around,
letting the sunlight move down into your chest and
back, into your abdomen and all of your internal
organs, allowing them to function smoothly, efficiently
and effortlessly, moving into your hips and your
legs, slowly down into your feet, not forcing
anything to happen, just allowing any relaxation
to occur naturally and at its own pace. If your
mind wanders, just have an oh well attitude and
bring your attention back to my voice and what
you're focusing on. This is very normal and
natural. No matter how many times this happens,
let go of any judgments of yourself. If you're
invited to connect with your heart, you can
also simply place your hand over your heart,
connecting with your higher self, your wisdom,
your intuition and any other support you would
like to have with you, perhaps spiritual support,
current or past loved ones, or anything that
would support you with your desired outcome.
Imagine yourself experiencing your desired
outcome and so it's happening right now. Notice
where you are or where you would be. What do you
see? What are you experiencing? What is it you're doing or being?
How do you feel? What might you look like?
Use all of your senses to imagine this scene
and experience it as though it were happening
right now.
What do you see? What might you hear?
What might you smell or taste? And how do you
feel having this desired outcome experience?
Perhaps it's bringing you a sense of joy or
a sense of freedom or peace. Maybe even just
simply a sense of being. See, sense and feel
yourself exactly how you would like to feel
and how you would like to feel and how you
would like to feel and how you would like to
feel and how you would like to feel.
If you are experiencing any limiting or negative
thoughts about picturing this scene or having
this experience, simply note what they are. These thoughts may need further attention
from you later or you can bring your hand over your heart and bring your attention to
your heart and the loving, compassionate part
of you and simply observe these thoughts,
these feelings or emotions from a place of unconditional love and acceptance. Knowing
these are simply thoughts and emotions, respecting
and honoring them versus judging and labeling
them. And when you're ready, you can bring
your attention back to your desired outcome.
And as much time experiencing your desired
outcome as you would like, when you're ready,
you can gently come back to your body, your
breath, the room, wherever you are, open your
eyes if they were closed and you may find it helpful to write down your experience in
a journal or create any art or perhaps allow
some type of object in your life to be placed
near you that might represent this desired outcome to help you achieve it. Thank you
so much for being with me.
